block.p: Monica Janine Washington, a lawyer, and Dr. Daniel Laurence Rothbaum were married yesterday at the Seven Hills Inn in Lenox, Mass. Rabbi Martin Siegel officiated, with the Rev. Sylvester Peterka, a Roman Catholic Priest, taking part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Washington Rothbaum, 30, is an associate at Covington & Burling, the Washington law firm. Next month, she is to become a clerk to Chief Judge Harry T. Edwards of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and received a law degree from New York University and a master's degree in public affairs from Princeton University.

Monica Janine Washington, a lawyer, and Dr. Daniel Laurence Rothbaum were married yesterday at the Seven Hills Inn in Lenox, Mass. Rabbi Martin Siegel officiated, with the Rev. Sylvester Peterka, a Roman Catholic Priest, taking part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Washington Rothbaum, 30, is an associate at Covington & Burling, the Washington law firm. Next month, she is to become a clerk to Chief Judge Harry T. Edwards of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and received a law degree from New York University and a master's degree in public affairs from Princeton University.
From 1992 to 1994, the bride was an assistant to Oscar Arias, the 1987 Nobel Peace Prize winner, at the Arias Foundation for Peace and Human Progress in Costa Rica.

The bride is a daughter of Rose Washington of New Lebanon, N.Y., and the late Wilmer Washington, and a stepdaughter of Regis McDonald of Dobbs Ferry, N.Y. Her mother, who was the New York City Commissioner of Juvenile Justice under Mayor David N. Dinkins, is the executive director of the Berkshire Farm Center and Services for Youth, a residential center for troubled youth in Canaan, N.Y. The bride's stepfather is a vice president for residential services at the Children's Village, a treatment center in Dobbs Ferry. Her father was the director of employment at the Bendix Corporation's military component plant in Sidney, N.Y.

Dr. Rothbaum, 29, is an intern in head and neck surgery at the Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore. He graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University and received his M.D. from Yale University. He is a son of Sandra Rothbaum and Dr. Donald Rothbaum of Carmel, Ind. His mother is a partner in Cohen, Garelick & Glazier, a law firm in Indianapolis, and his father, a cardiologist, is a managing partner in the Care Group there.
